security_audit.summary: Pure markdown knowledge-base skill with no executable code. Contains only informational content about security engineering topics.

content.value_statement: Design secure systems and implement robust security controls. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on security architecture, authentication, authorization, and compliance frameworks.
actual_capabilities: Conduct threat modeling using STRIDE methodology
Ensure compliance with SOC2, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, and GDPR
limitations: Requires additional tools for actual implementation
Does not execute security scans or tests
Cannot access external security databases or CVE feeds
Does not provide real-time security monitoring

use_cases.title: Build Secure Applications
use_cases.description: Apply secure coding practices and implement proper authentication, authorization, and input validation in your code.

use_cases.title: Design Security Frameworks
use_cases.description: Create defense-in-depth architectures and zero trust models for enterprise systems.

use_cases.title: Implement Security Controls
use_cases.description: Integrate security testing, compliance checks, and monitoring into CI/CD pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my system architecture for security gaps using the defense-in-depth approach. Identify weaknesses in each layer from perimeter to data.

prompt_templates.title: AuthZ Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an access control system for my application. Should I use RBAC or ABAC? Show implementation examples with least privilege principles.

prompt_templates.title: Threat Model
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct threat modeling using STRIDE for my e-commerce checkout flow. What are the main risks and how do I mitigate them?

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: What security controls do I need to implement for SOC2 compliance? Show the key policies and technical requirements.

output_examples.input: How do I prevent SQL injection in my Python application?
output: Use parameterized queries with placeholders instead of string concatenation
Example: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s', (user_id,))
Never interpolate user input directly into SQL strings
Enable SQLAlchemy ORM which uses parameterized queries by default
Implement input validation as a secondary defense layer

best_practices: Apply defense-in-depth with security controls at multiple layers
Follow zero trust principles: never trust, always verify
Implement least privilege access for all system components
anti_patterns: Storing secrets in environment variables without rotation
Skipping input validation on the client side
Using deprecated authentication methods like MD5 for passwords

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidance applicable across all major AI coding assistants.

faq.question: Does this skill perform security scans?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and patterns. You need separate tools like Semgrep, OWASP ZAP, or Snyk for actual security scanning.

faq.question: Can this skill help with compliance audits?
faq.answer: Yes. It outlines control requirements for SOC2, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, GDPR, and ISO 27001. It does not replace formal audit processes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. No data leaves your environment. All processing happens within your AI tool.

faq.question: Why are my security recommendations not working?
faq.answer: Ensure you are providing enough context about your system. Complex environments may require multiple prompt iterations to cover all aspects.

faq.question: How does this compare to other security tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides strategic guidance and patterns. Tools like SAST/DAST scanners provide automated detection. Use both together for comprehensive coverage.
